item.description: [According to some] There is actually very little evidence that hyper-rationalist Maimonideans who didn't pray or keep mitzvot actually existed. There were tendentious reports of such people (especially in the letters that led to the Maimonidean controversies, e.g. Abba Mari of Lunel), but little hard evidence. item.content:encoded:
[According to some] There is actually very little evidence that hyper-rationalist Maimonideans who didn’t pray or keep mitzvot actually existed. There were tendentious reports of such people (especially in the letters that led to the Maimonidean controversies, e.g. Abba Mari of Lunel), but little hard evidence. See David Berger’s “Judaism and General Culture in Medieval and Early Modern Times.”
